content.description:
The picture on the left indicates Starting Position for Pedal.

The arm that extends from the center of the circular gear is parallel to the level ground.

Point P on the pedal is at a height of 12 inches above the level ground. Point P is at the same height as the center of the circular gear.

The picture on the right identifies the 8 inch arm that extends from the center of a circular gear to the pedal.

Point P on the pedal is at a height that is below the center of the circular gear. The arm is oriented down and to the right.

A physical therapy center has a bicycle that patients use for exercise. The height, in inches (in), of the bicycle pedal above level ground periodically increases and decreases when used. The figure gives the position of the pedal <math alttext="P"> <semantics> <mi>P</mi> <annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation> </semantics> </math> at a height of <math alttext="12"><semantics><mn>12</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> inches above the ground at time <math alttext="t equals 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> seconds. The pedal’s <math alttext="8"><semantics><mn>8</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-inch arm defines the circular motion of the pedal.
content.question: If a patient pedals <math alttext="1"><semantics><mn>1</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> revolution per second, which of the following could be an expression for <math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, the height, in inches, of the bicycle pedal above level ground at time <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> seconds?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="8 minus 12 sin open parentheses 2 pi t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mn>8</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="12 minus 8 sin open parentheses 2 pi t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mn>12</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="12 minus 8 sin open parentheses 2 pi t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mn>12</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 3.7: Sinusoidal Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
